sdgs.relevance:
MentorED is an open source mentoring application that facilitates lifelong learning and continuous professional development by enabling discovery of trusted mentors and mechanisms. National Education Policy 2020 in India proposes mentoring as a solution at various levels to improve the quality of outcomes. 
The National Council for Teacher Education (NCTE) proposes a nationwide mission to incorporate mentoring to improve the acquisition and sharing of knowledge, skills, and mindsets across the Indian education system.
Teachers and School Heads need new solutions to today’s unprecedented demands and challenges. The community of educators and leaders in education in itself is rich with experts, who have the knowledge and skills to contribute towards problem-solving and capacity building of peers. Systems capable of adapting to the rapidly changing environment can empower their citizens with the right mix of skills to allow them to lead satisfying professional and personal lives. This leads to inclusive and sustainable economic growth. 
A structure of mentoring, therefore, offers a solution to address the existing gaps in a more decentralised manner. These are the gaps in accessing expertise, continuous professional development, connecting with peers from similar contexts and the absence of a platform to leverage cross-learning. MentorED will be leveraged to implement this nationwide mentoring mission for various outcomes of public education in India.
MentorED, which is also an open-source NDEAR Compliant modular building block, is designed for scale and reliability. 
MentoringBlueBook - https://ncte.gov.in/WebAdminFiles/PublicNotice/English_0_04_11_2021_637716090580188670.pdf

Good Health and Well Being : MentorED is an open source application that can be adopted in the health sector for using the application to increase knowledge among providers and hence provide better health and good well being for people. This is inspired by ECHO model- https://hsc.unm.edu/echo/what-we-do/about-the-echo-model.html. 

Reduced Inequalities :
MentorED is an open source application which provides an opportunity to leverage cross learning amongst different individuals leading to their continuous professional development. It makes mentoring accessible to any individual who needs it, regardless of age, background or ethnicities. Several programs will be conceptualised for grassroots inequity by nonprofits and government institutions.

NonPII.nonPIIAccessMechanism:
MentorED is a building block on ELEVATE(Energizing Leadership with Enhanced Visibility and Administrative Transformation towards Excellence) is an Open Source under MIT License. MentorEd software has implemented many best practices to keep user data safe and secure. Users are empowered to safeguard and share their data with appropriate consent management mechanisms. Default software has implemented data collection in an open and transparent manner. 
MentorEd  has APIs and tools to manage users and transactional data which uses JSON as the native data format. In some cases, tools have been developed to support import and export in CSV format.
MentorEd follows best practices for keeping data secure, safe, and encrypted wherever required. The software by itself is open source and hence the adopter may modify it as per the requirements. 
Reports with non-PII are available for extraction via scripts.

Adopters of MentorEd globally in different countries will be able to extend and configure it to comply with the various laws and regulations governing the data privacy, protection, and sharing.

dataPrivacySecurity.dataPrivacySecurity:
MentorED follows many best practices to keep user data safe and secure. No personal data is shared among collaborators and only with explicit consent of all participating individuals, a collaboration flow can be triggered. 

Registrations of users are done in a regulated manner , for example there is a help page for reporting any issue. MentorED software implements principles of minimalism, consent, transparency of data collection, and other best practices. Please see earlier and following responses for details about privacy and data security.

Some of the steps taken to ensure safety of users are:

Profile controls to modify and manage data stored against user profile 
Two-Factor Authentication (OTP based)
Users join a Group by accepting an invite. No one can add a user to a group without their consent.
Users can exit discussion areas at any time
Users agree to terms and condition 

While MentorED is built with all of the above capabilities and best practices, it is upto the adopter to implement these. MentorED as an open-source software is free to use and modify as required.

Registrations of users are done in a regulated manner , for example there is a help page for reporting any issue. MentorED software implements principles of minimalism, consent, transparency of data collection, and other best practices. Please see earlier and following responses for details about privacy and data security. In 24 hours the issues reported are addressed. 

Some of the steps taken to ensure safety of users are:

Profile controls to modify and manage data stored against user profile 
Two-Factor Authentication (OTP based)
Users join a Group by accepting an invite. No one can add a user to a group without their consent.
Users can exit discussion areas at any time
Users agree to terms and condition 

Process that addresses safety and security of underage users :
Sessions are recorded for ensuring security; 
A support page to raise concerns; 
No PII data is shared within the users ;
No communication is possible between the users outside the session;

MentorED has a microservices for reporting . But, typically adopters extend this to cater to specific needs of the users and processes within their context.

privacy.privacyCompliance:
MentorED is a building block on ELEVATE(Energizing Leadership with Enhanced Visibility and Administrative Transformation towards Excellence) is an Open Source under MIT License.

MentorED software has implemented many best practices to keep user data safe and secure. Default software has implemented data collection in an open and transparent manner. MentorED software implements principles of minimalism, consent, transparency of data collection, and other best practices. 
MentorED enables adopters to collect data in an open, transparent, and consented manner - stores it safely & securely - and shares data in an anonymised manner.
MentorED is also compliant with National Digital Education Architecture (NDEAR) design principles architecture and building blocks. 
https://microimp.ndear.gov.in/about-ndear.html

Links to Privacy Policy and terms of use :

https://shikshalokam.org/mentoring/term-of-use

Adopters of MentorED globally in different countries will be able to extend and configure it to comply with the various laws and regulations governing the data privacy, protection, and sharing.
privacy.privacyComplianceURL:
As an open source-code solution, MentorED will have to be viewed differently from hosted service/product solutions. While the source code is open, free and available to all interested implementers/adopters (on GitHub), individual implementations may have their own view of how they may have addressed data management (PII/non-PII), hosting of the solution and so forth. 

Management of PII/non-PII data in MentorED is purely a “highly extensible/configurable/non-opinionated open-software solution”, and it’s source code lies in GitHub (MentorED is not a ‘hosted service or product’). Implementers/adopters of MentorED , have the autonomy to decide “what” fields to be capture/maintain, “what” other systems will they integrate with, “will” they share this data with other authorized parties (e.g. one Government sharing this dataset with other Government, or one Department sharing this dataset with other Department). While the MentorED technical architecture has taken privacy and security controls into consideration as default implementation, it is up to the Implementers/Adopters to establish a privacy policy at their end to cover the various implementation scenarios (e.g. management & sharing of PII/non PII data).
